questions.text: A 32-year-old woman presents to AIIMS OPD with complaints of oligomenorrhea for the past six months. She has a history of two previous pregnancies, both of which resulted in miscarriages. She underwent an HSG which is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) GU TB

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Salpingitis isthmica nodosa seen on HSG is a classic manifestation of genitourinary tuberculosis (GU TB) , characterized by nodular outpouchings in the fallopian tubes, and can be associated with infertility and menstrual irregularities.

questions.text: Identify the nerve block given at the point shown:

A 25-year-old male patient presented with sudden onset breathlessness and a sharp pain in his left chest after a road traffic accident. His BP is 85/69 mmHg and HR is 110 bpm. The chest X-ray is given below. What is the next step for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Insert iv cannula and start iv fluids

questions.text: A 4-year-old child presents with a history of progressive weakness, irritability, and delayed growth. He was started on appropriate treatment at a CHC. A repeat wrist X-ray is performed, as shown. Based on the clinical features and radiographic findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old woman presents with a severe, sudden-onset, throbbing headache and double vision for the past 30 minutes. She has a history of migraine and reports frequent headaches. She has not had her period for several months. On examination, her blood pressure is 95/61 mmHg, and visual field testing reveals decreased visual acuity and loss of peripheral vision in both eyes. MRI of brain is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient who was diagnosed with prostate cancer is being investigated. The bone scan is shown below. What does it indicate?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased uptake due to diffuse metastasis

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased uptake due to diffuse metastasis
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Increased uptake due to diffuse metastasis

questions.text: An ultrasound of a 24-year-old woman shows an endometrium with a classic trilaminar appearance, as seen in the image provided. Which phase of the menstrual cycle does this ultrasound image most likely represent?
Which of the following will be avid on FDG PET scan?

A 70-year-old man comes to the casualty after 3 episodes of sudden loss of vision in his right eye like a curtain falling down, each of which resolved spontaneously after about 2 minutes. He has a history of hypertension and diabetes. Neurological examination of the patient is normal. What investigation would aid in the management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: MRI Diffusion-weighted imaging of the brain

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the trauma center after RTA with shortness of breath. The supine CXR is shown below. The BP is 109/88 mmHg and pulse is 98/min. What is the next step?
A 56-year-old male presents with sudden onset altered semsorium. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old man is brought to the emergency department following a road traffic accident. He is unconscious with a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of 5/15 and exhibits decerebrate rigidity. A CT scan of the brain is performed to assess potential injuries, and the image is shown below. Based on the CT brain findings and the patient's clinical presentation, what is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45 year old male patient underwent a routine USG following which this finding was noted. What is false regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Cetrimide, Hypertonic saline may be used for PAIR

options.label: C
options.text: PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication

options.label: D
options.text: Echinococcus granulosus parasite is the most common causative agent

questions.correct_answer: C. PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication
questions.explanation: Ans. C) PAIR is the treatment of choice in cysto-biliary communication.

questions.text: What is the most likely cause of the condition depicted in the HRCT below?
What is the likely diagnosis based on the images shown?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Maffucci syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Maffucci syndrome is distinguished by the combination of multiple enchondromas and soft-tissue hemangiomas, often seen as phleboliths on imaging.

questions.text: Identify the fracture site in the X-ray shown below.

options.label: A
options.text: Right posterior end of 5 th rib

options.label: B
options.text: Right posterior end of 6 th rib

options.label: C
options.text: Right posterior end of 7 th rib

options.label: D
options.text: Right anterior end of 6 th rib

questions.correct_answer: B. Right posterior end of 6 th rib

questions.text: A 2-year-old child with a history of fall 1 year back with parietal bone fracture, has now presented with a painful and growing parietal swelling. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 46-year-old male presented to the clinic with a persistent cough, fatigue, weight loss. Xray of the patient is as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
All of the following are true about MRCP except

options.label: B
options.text: Contrast material must be injected in the ductal system

questions.correct_answer: B. Contrast material must be injected in the ductal system
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Contrast material must be injected in the ductal system

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with progressive hearing loss in the right ear and occasional imbalance over the past year. MRI of the brain is shown below. Which of the following genetic mutations is most likely associated with this patient's condition?

A 60-year-old male presents to the casualty with chest pain radiating to the back. He is diagnosed with a type A aortic dissection and undergoes emergent open repair. During the postoperative period, he develops thoracic back pain and an inability to move his bilateral lower extremities. Pinprick testing reveals bilateral loss of pain and temperature sensation below the level of the xiphoid process. Injury to which of the following arteries most likely explains this patient’s clinical presentation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Artery of Adamkiewicz

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Understand the role of the artery of Adamkiewicz in supplying the thoracolumbar region of the spinal cord. Recognize anterior spinal artery syndrome as a complication of aortic dissection and its repair. Differentiate between vascular territories of the spinal cord and their clinical implications.
  • ➤ Understand the role of the artery of Adamkiewicz in supplying the thoracolumbar region of the spinal cord.
  • ➤ artery of Adamkiewicz
  • ➤ Recognize anterior spinal artery syndrome as a complication of aortic dissection and its repair.
  • ➤ anterior spinal artery syndrome
  • ➤ Differentiate between vascular territories of the spinal cord and their clinical implications.

questions.text: Identify the heart chamber marked in the given CT image:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Left atrium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The left atrium is the posterior-most heart chamber, situated just anterior to the vertebral column and adjacent to the aorta, making it identifiable on axial CT images of the chest.

questions.text: A patient presents to emergency department with chronic ear discharge and headache with ear pain. CT revealed the following findings. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the investigation of choice for PTH adenoma?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tc99-Sestamibi scan

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Tc99-Sestamibi scan is the preferred imaging modality for localizing parathyroid adenomas, particularly in cases of primary hyperparathyroidism, due to its high sensitivity and ability to differentiate parathyroid from thyroid tissue.
  • ➤ Tc99-Sestamibi scan

questions.text: A 15-year-old male presents with pain and swelling in the thigh since last one month. X-ray is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not considered a benefit of USG compared to Mammography?

options.label: A
options.text: Can be used for screening mammographically undetectable or clinically non palpable breast mass

options.label: B
options.text: Useful in young females with dense breast

options.label: C
options.text: Differentiates between solid and Cystic lesions in the Breast

questions.correct_answer: A. Can be used for screening mammographically undetectable or clinically non palpable breast mass
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Can be used for screening mammographically undetectable clinically non palpable breast mass

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis based on the CT urography images shown below?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Retrocaval ureter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Retrocaval ureter is a congenital anomaly where the right ureter passes behind the inferior vena cava (IVC), leading to a characteristic "fish-hook" appearance on imaging.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis based on the Xray ?
What is the minimum amount of fluid to be detected by this X-ray?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 25 ml

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A lateral chest X-ray can detect as little as 25 ml of pleural fluid , making it a more sensitive option for identifying small pleural effusions compared to an upright PA chest X-ray.
  • ➤ 25 ml of pleural fluid

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents with a history of RTA with intense pain in the suprapubic region. On examination, abdominal distention was present. Heart rate and blood pressure was normal. Imaging is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
A lady was incidentally diagnosed with a 0.5 cm solid mass in her gall bladder on USG as shown. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Reassure the patient and follow up

questions.correct_answer: A. Reassure the patient and follow up
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Reassure the patient and follow up

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For gallbladder polyps less than 1 cm , conservative management with follow-up imaging is typically appropriate, as the risk of malignancy is low.
  • ➤ gallbladder polyps less than 1 cm
  • ➤ follow-up imaging

questions.text: A 4-month-old girl is diagnosed with a febrile urinary tract infection. A voiding cystourethrogram is shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this infant's presentation?

options.label: C
options.text: Obstruction due to a renal stone

options.label: D
options.text: Presence of a posterior urethral valve

questions.correct_answer: A. Congenital short intravesical ureter length
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Congenital short intravesical ureter length

questions.text: A 45-year-old man is evaluated in the emergency department for chest pain that developed while eating a piece of steak at a restaurant. He reports intermittent episodes of food (particularly meat) getting stuck in his lower chest over the past 3 years. Patient’s barium swallow image is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 13-year-old boy presents to the trauma center after a skid injury, with lower abdominal pain and blood at the meatus. The bladder is not palpable. What is the next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) RGU (Retrograde urethrogram)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a patient with trauma and blood at the urethral meatus , retrograde urethrogram (RGU) is the next best step to evaluate for a possible urethral injury before attempting catheterization or other interventions.
  • ➤ retrograde urethrogram (RGU)

questions.text: Identify the image?
What is the most likely diagnosis according to the given image in a 35 year old male presenting post-RTA?
A 3-month-old baby presents to you with jaundice. USG of the liver shows the following abnormality. What is the best investigation to confirm the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Intra-operative cholangiography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For infants with suspected biliary atresia , intra-operative cholangiography is the best investigation to confirm the diagnosis, as it provides direct visualization of the biliary tree and guides surgical management.
  • ➤ biliary atresia
  • ➤ intra-operative cholangiography

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient presents to their primary care physician with a complaint of dysphagia. He reports that he experiences a sensation of food getting stuck in his throat when he eats. He also reports some mild chest discomfort with exertion. The patient has a history of Down syndrome and congenital heart disease. A barium swallow is shown here. Which imaging modality should be performed next?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Computed tomography angiography (CTA)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient with dysphagia and suspicion of a vascular anomaly causing extrinsic compression of the esophagus, computed tomography angiography (CTA) is the preferred imaging modality to visualize the vascular structures and their relationship to the esophagus.
  • ➤ computed tomography angiography (CTA)

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman comes to the emergency department following a fall with severe back pain, vomiting, and hypotension. CT findings are given below. What is the diagnosis?

An 8-month-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to respiratory distress. Severe cough and wheezing began an hour ago while the patient was playing at his cousin’s house. The chest radiograph is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Foreign body aspiration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Foreign body aspiration should be considered in children with a sudden onset of respiratory distress and unilateral hyperinflation on chest radiographs, especially when the symptoms began during play or after eating.
  • ➤ Foreign body aspiration

questions.text: Which of the following statement is false regarding X-Rays?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of soft tissue planes is the earliest X-ray change of infection

options.label: B
options.text: Glass pieces can be seen as radiopaque in X-ray images

options.label: C
options.text: Cartilage is not visualized on X-ray.

options.label: D
options.text: Live bone is more radio-opaque than dead bone on X-Ray images

questions.correct_answer: D. Live bone is more radio-opaque than dead bone on X-Ray images
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Live bone is more radio-opaque than dead bone on X-Ray images.

questions.text: A woman has been diagnosed with endometrial carcinoma and is undergoing radiotherapy. Choose the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source

options.label: B
options.text: Small blood vessels are most radioresistant

options.label: C
options.text: Rapidly proliferating cells are most radioresistant

options.label: D
options.text: Small intestinal mucosa is most radio-resistant

questions.correct_answer: A. Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The inverse square law is a fundamental concept in radiotherapy, stating that the intensity of radiation decreases with the square of the distance from the source, allowing for precise targeting of tumors while minimizing exposure to surrounding tissues.
  • ➤ inverse square law

questions.text: A 32-year-old primigravida at 32 weeks of gestation comes with complaints of absent fetal movements over the last week. Examination shows absent fetal heart sounds. Ultrasonographic examination shows overlapping of skull bones and absent FHR. Which of the following is false about this likely condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Hyperflexion of spine may be seen

options.label: C
options.text: Spontaneous expulsion rarely occurs in these patients and induction is required

options.label: D
options.text: Infection by gas-forming organisms is likely after rupture of membranes

questions.correct_answer: C. Spontaneous expulsion rarely occurs in these patients and induction is required
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Spontaneous expulsion rarely occurs in these patients and induction is required

questions.text: Empty thecal sac sign on MRI is seen in:
A child presents with breathlessness. On chest X-ray, the following object is seen. Identify?
All of these are causes of bilious vomiting in a neonate at birth except?
A 35-year-old male patient presents with low backache for 20 days. CE-MRI is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Pott's spine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pott's spine (spinal tuberculosis) often presents with chronic back pain, vertebral body destruction, and paraspinal abscess formation. It should be considered in patients with insidious onset of symptoms and characteristic MRI findings.
  • ➤ Pott's spine (spinal tuberculosis)

questions.text: A 38-year-old female presented to the emergency department with the sudden onset of severe epigastric pain. On physical exam, she had a temperature of 100.4° F, a pulse of 115bpm and a blood pressure of 125/72mmHg. Abdomen was tender & rigid. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old man presents to the emergency department after a road traffic accident (RTA). His blood pressure is 80/60 mmHg, his pulse is 110 bpm, and his respiratory rate is 18 breaths per minute. Which of the following will be the next step in this case?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) eFAST

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In hemodynamically unstable trauma patients, the initial assessment should prioritize rapid identification of internal bleeding. The eFAST exam is the preferred first-line diagnostic tool in such cases due to its speed, non-invasive nature, and ability to guide immediate intervention.

questions.text: What could be the possible diagnosis of a 35-year-old male patient with a palpable flank lump whose ultrasound abdomen is shown below?
